updateLdapEntry
A function designed for making changes to an existing entry in the Microsoft Active Directory Service when connected via the LDAP protocol.
Syntax
updateLdapEntry
(obj, entryDn, modifications)
Parameter
Purpose
obj
An object with settings for connecting to the directory service via the LDAP protocol.
Object of the "LDAP Connection Settings" type [SYS_LDAP_SETTINGS] is selected as a value using the
dict
functions.
entryDn
The parameter specifies the directory of the record, the value of which needs to be changed
The parameter is set as
text
.
The parameter specifies the path
excluding
the root directory defined in the
LDAP connection settings
.
modifications
Changes that need to be made to the specified entity.
Note
Functions are added manually.
Special functions are additionally used to update the record. These functions generate a list of necessary changes, which are then applied to an entry in the Active Directory Service:
addLdapAttribute
– adds a new attribute value;
addLdapAttribute
(name, value)
Parameter
Purpose
name
Name of the Active Directory Service attribute to add a value to.
Specified as
text
.
value
Representing the passed value. The one attribute can have multiple values.
replaceLdapAttribute
– replaces the value of the specified attribute;
replaceLdapAttribute
(name, value)
Parameter
Purpose
name
Name of the Active Directory Service attribute which value is required to be replaced.
Specified as
text
.
value
Representing the passed value. The one attribute can have multiple values.
removeLdapAttribute
– deletes the attribute value.
removeLdapAttribute
(name, [value])
Parameter
Purpose
name
Name of the Active Directory Service attribute which value is reqiured to be deleted.
Specified as
text
.
value
Optional parameter.
If a parameter value is specified, then only the key-value pair will be deleted, in other words, only the specified values will be deleted from the attribute.
The user’s password must be passed in quotation marks and encoded format.
Example
Let’s take look at an example of an algorithm for replacing the user’s password in the Active Directory Service. To do this, set up a
connection to the Active Directory Service
, and then
create an algorithm
.
The algorithm can look as follows:
Use the
replaceLdapAttribute
function to specify the user’s new password in the algorithm. The made changes are an array that is set via the new
modifications
variable.
Using the
updateLdapEntry
function, the specified password must be sent to the Active Directory Service. To do this:
The first parameter of the function using the
dict
function specifies an object with settings for connecting to the Active Directory Service.
The second parameter defines the path to the entity to which the changes are made.
In the third parameter, changes made to the record are transferred using the modifications function.
In this case, the password is transmitted in UTF-16LE encoding.
